title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to collaborate on Norwegian CCS hub
summary1: Oilfield services major Baker Hughes and Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer Borg CO2 have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a CCS project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway.
title2: Baker Hughes Partners with Borg CO2 for CCS Project
summary2: Under a MOU signed between Baker Hughes and Borg CO2, both the companies will work together to develop a Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS) hub for industrial sites in Viken, Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 630,000 tons of CO2 emissions every year.

title1: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary1: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.
title2: Eco Wave Power selected for accelerator projects in Spain and the UK
summary2: Israeli company Eco Wave Power has been selected to participate in two European accelerator programmes, developments which the company will leverage to expand its global footprint.

title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Eco Wave Power joins two European business accelerators
summary1: Swedish-Israeli wave energy company Eco Wave Power has been selected to join business accelerator programs in two of the most attractive markets for wave energy – the UK and Spain.
title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Eco Wave Power joins two European business accelerators

title2: Eco Wave joins ocean modelling project. Developer to participate in the EU-funded ILIAD Consortium.

title1: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary1: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

title2: Mocean Energy Blue X Arrives In Orkney
summary2: Mocean Energy’s Blue X wave energy prototype has been unloaded at Hatston Pier, Kirkwall, Orkney in advance of sea trials which will take place at the European Marine Energy Centre (EMEC) this summer. title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary1: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.
title2: Scotland approves 450MW Red John pumped storage hydro project
summary2: The pumped storage hydro project will be built with a total investment of £550m.

summary2: Havfram has secured a contract with Technip Energies for the pre-installation and hook-up of the subsea mooring system for the natural gas floating production storage and offloading (FPSO) at the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) project.

summary2: Scottish company Mocean Energy has started testing its Blue X wave energy prototype at the European Marine Energy Centre (EMEC) in Orkney.

title2: Mocean Energy Blue X Arrives In Orkney
summary2: Mocean Energy’s Blue X wave energy prototype has been unloaded at Hatston Pier, Kirkwall, Orkney in advance of sea trials which will take place at the European Marine Energy Centre (EMEC) this summer. The wave machine has been fabricated wholly in Scotland and was transported by road from Rosyth to Aberdeen and then by ship to Orkney.

title2: Mocean Energy Blue X Arrives In Orkney
summary2: Mocean Energy’s Blue X wave energy prototype has been unloaded at Hatston Pier, Kirkwall, Orkney in advance of sea trials which will take place at the European Marine Energy Centre (EMEC) this summer. The wave machine has been fabricated wholly in Scotland and was transported by road from Rosyth to Aberdeen and then by ship to Orkney.

title1: Equinor to sell petroleum refining business in Denmark
summary1: Equinor Energy AS (Stavanger, Norway) has entered into an agreement with the Klesch Group for the sale of its petroleum refining business in Denmark.
title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Ulsan, South Korea to host 270-MW hydrogen-turbine demonstration project
summary1: Doosan Heavy Industries & Construction (Changwon, South Korea) signed a memorandum of understanding with Ulsan Metropolitan City, Korea East-West Power and SK Gas on pursuing a hydrogen-gas turbine demonstration project. According to the MoU, Ulsan Metropolitan City will be providing administrative support on implementing infrastructure needed for the hydrogen gas turbine business, whereas Korea East-West Power will be handling the demonstration of the hydrogen gas turbine using Korean technology, and SK Gas will be in charge of laying the foundation for hydrogen supply, while Doosan will be handling the technology development and supply of hydrogen gas turbines.

title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

The program’s launch comes amid concern about proposed changes to ARENA’s funding mandate as the Commonwealth Government seeks to expand definitions to include funding for controversial technologies and fossil fuel projects.
title2: Siemens to provide electrical equipment for Bacalhau field offshore Brazil
summary2: Siemens will provide pressure and temperature sensors, and electrical distribution equipment for the Bacalhau field.

title2: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary2: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

title1: Eco Wave Power Selected for Two Accelerator Programs
summary1: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

summary1: As a selected member of the Accelerator programs for Spain (Rising UP in Spain) and the UK (Cleantech Bootcamp 2021), Eco Wave Power has been given a unique opportunity to establish partnerships and grow in two of the world's most attractive markets for wave energy. The Spanish program will run over six to eight months, whereas the UK program will run for a duration of four weeks with program partners including the British Embassy in Israel, and corporates such as Shell, Octopus Energy, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, National Grid, and the Clean Growth Fund among others. Both programs aim to facilitate business opportunities through custom-made investor networks, entry to major national and international events, business development and legal support, as well as local marketing and communication.

According to the MoU, Ulsan Metropolitan City will be providing administrative support on implementing infrastructure needed for the hydrogen gas turbine business, whereas Korea East-West Power will be handling the demonstration of the hydrogen gas turbine using Korean technology, and SK Gas will be in charge of laying the foundation for hydrogen supply, while Doosan will be handling the technology development and supply of hydrogen gas turbines.

title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Ulsan, South Korea to host 270-MW hydrogen-turbine demonstration project
summary1: Doosan Heavy Industries & Construction (Changwon, South Korea) signed a memorandum of understanding with Ulsan Metropolitan City, Korea East-West Power and SK Gas on pursuing a hydrogen-gas turbine demonstration project. According to the MoU, Ulsan Metropolitan City will be providing administrative support on implementing infrastructure needed for the hydrogen gas turbine business, whereas Korea East-West Power will be handling the demonstration of the hydrogen gas turbine using Korean technology, and SK Gas will be in charge of laying the foundation for hydrogen supply, while Doosan will be handling the technology development and supply of hydrogen gas turbines.

summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Ulsan, South Korea to host 270-MW hydrogen-turbine demonstration project
summary1: Doosan Heavy Industries & Construction (Changwon, South Korea) signed a memorandum of understanding with Ulsan Metropolitan City, Korea East-West Power and SK Gas on pursuing a hydrogen-gas turbine demonstration project. According to the MoU, Ulsan Metropolitan City will be providing administrative support on implementing infrastructure needed for the hydrogen gas turbine business, whereas Korea East-West Power will be handling the demonstration of the hydrogen gas turbine using Korean technology, and SK Gas will be in charge of laying the foundation for hydrogen supply, while Doosan will be handling the technology development and supply of hydrogen gas turbines.

title2: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary2: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

title1: Baker Hughes and Borg CO2 to develop carbon capture and storage hub in Norway
summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.

summary1: Baker Hughes (Houston) and Borg CO2 AS, a Norwegian carbon capture and storage developer for industrial clusters, have announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project to serve as a hub for the decarbonization of industrial sites in the Viken region of Norway. The project aims to capture and store up to 90% of the CO2 emissions from the involved industrial sites, playing an important role in contributing to the Paris Agreement goals, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Norwegian national emissions reduction targets.
title2: Hibernia contract renewal for Wood
summary2: Hibernia Management and Development Company (HMDC) has renewed a contract with Wood Plc to provide engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) solutions and maintenance to the Hibernia platform off the coast of St. John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.
